summary: This bill, the Help Independent Tracks Succeed Act (HITS Act), amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow an election to expense certain qualified sound recording costs. It treats qualified sound recording productions similarly to qualified film or television productions and live theatrical productions, permitting deductions up to $150,000. It also amends bonus depreciation rules to include qualified sound recording productions, considering them placed in service at the time of initial release. The amendments are effective for productions commencing in taxable years ending after the bill's enactment.
